column4: Can someone help with an ATI 9800 driver install?  I've followed various instructions I've found, but still seem to be stuck in MESA mode :(  I'm not sure what info to give, I've not seen any error.  (xorg.conf: http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/8662,  dmesg: http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/8663, messages: http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/8664)
I was hoping for something like "0000:01:00.0 VGA compatible controller: ATI Technologies Inc Radeon RV250 If [Radeon 9000]  (rev 01)"
lemme get you to try something...
as root, open /etc/X11/xorg.conf in your favourite editor (e.g. nano)
Oh, you are trying to use the non-free drivers.
I tried the ATI ones first, and they're not .  Should I be using others?
the free driver "radeon" should give you 2d and probably 3d acceleration.
the free driver "ati" is much older than "radeon".
do I need to download anything extra, or just change Driver to "radeon"?
change it, save file, restart X server (Ctrl+Alt+Backspace)
you can test for 3d accel by running glxinfo|head and looking for "direct rendering: yes"
